Pre-Game Insights: The Toronto Blue Jays are aiming to end a five-game skid when facing the Boston Red Sox.
The Blue Jays have a 38-39 record at home and a 73-85 overall record.
The Red Sox have an 80-78 overall record and a 43-37 record on the road.
The teams are meeting for the 13th time this season, with the Red Sox leading 8-4 in the series.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. has 43 doubles, a triple, 30 home runs, and 102 RBI for the Blue Jays.
Tyler O'Neill leads the Red Sox with 31 home runs while slugging.517.
The Blue Jays are 24-12 in games when they did not allow a home run.
The Red Sox have the third-ranked team on-base percentage in the AL at.320.
Others: The game features key matchups between Vladimir Guerrero Jr. and Tyler O'Neill, as well as Kevin Gausman and Richard Fitts on the mound.
